item.title: The Vital Role of Dustoff Pilots in Vietnam
item.description: A look at the crucial work of Dustoff pilots in Vietnam, highlighting their medical evacuations, dedication, and impact on saving countless lives during the conflict.

media:content.media:title: The Vital Role of Dustoff Pilots in Vietnam
media:content.media:description: A look at the crucial work of Dustoff pilots in Vietnam, highlighting their medical evacuations, dedication, and impact on saving countless lives during the conflict.

item.title: Navy Pilot’s Years of Captivity and Survival
item.description: The story of a Navy pilot who endured 2,675 days in captivity, reflecting on resilience, service, and the challenges faced during this difficult chapter in military history.

item.title: Honoring America’s Rosie the Riveters
item.description: At the 2025 American Valor Conference, Rosie the Riveters are recognized for their vital WWII contributions, celebrating the women who helped build the equipment that powered the Allied victory.

item.title: We Crash-landed and then Went to a Nightclub
item.description: A wild story that jumps from a chaotic crash-landing straight into an unforgettable night out.

item.title: WWII Veteran Ed Miklavcic joined the Air Force in 1940, when he was 20 years old, and he served his country from the beginning of the war to the end.
item.description: A moving tribute to Ed Miklavcic’s lifelong service, following his journey through the entire span of World War II.

item.title: American Hero, Fighter Pilot, and Youngest Moonwalker
item.description: A remarkable look at the life of a man who soared through combat skies and later walked on the Moon.

item.title: I Made a Beer Run During the Battle of the Bulge
item.description: A surprising wartime memory where a simple beer run brought humor to the chaos of the Battle of the Bulge.

item.title: Being in The First Wave at Omaha Beach
item.description: A powerful firsthand reflection on the brutal reality of stepping into the first wave at Omaha Beach.

item.title: 101st Airborne Vet Recalls D-Day & Market Garden Jumps
item.description: A vivid recollection of the daring airborne jumps that defined D-Day and Operation Market Garden.

item.title:
Following John F. Kennedy’s assassination, U.S. Navy Veteran Jim Leavelle would be the first man to interrogate Lee Harvey Oswald in connection with the murder of Dallas police officer J.D. Tippit. At the time of the interrogation, Oswald was not yet a suspect in the Kennedy assassination.
On this day in 1963, Lee Harvey Oswald was handcuffed between Leavelle and fellow detective L. C. Graves as he was being led through the basement of the Dallas Police Headquarters to an armored car for the short trip from the city jail to the county jail. Jack Ruby then stepped from the crowd and fatally shot Oswald at point-blank range.
item.description: A gripping recount of the moments leading up to Oswald’s fatal shooting as told by the detective who first interrogated him.

item.title: Providing Overwatch for Marines in Fallujah
item.description: A tense look at the responsibility and focus required to protect Marines on the ground in Fallujah.

item.title: Ball Turret Gunner: Operating From the Deadliest Position
item.description: A gripping look at the courage required to fight from the most dangerous spot on a WWII bomber.

item.title: I Couldn't Understand Anything Our Code Talkers Said
item.description: A candid memory of working with Code Talkers whose language was impossible to grasp yet vital to victory.

item.title: The Landing Decision that Saved My Life on D-Day
item.description: A gripping account of a split-second landing choice that meant the difference between life and death on D-Day.

item.title: Ross McCall and the Unsung Heroes of Easy Company
item.description: A heartfelt spotlight on Ross McCall’s tribute to the overlooked courage of Easy Company’s true heroes.

item.title: Surviving WWII as a BAR Rifleman
item.description: A firsthand look at the relentless challenges faced by a WWII BAR rifleman fighting to stay alive.

item.title: We were so proud to honor our WWII Veterans at American Valor and hear U.S. Merchant Marine Dave Yoho’s special message for the audience
item.description: A heartfelt tribute celebrating our WWII Veterans and sharing Dave Yoho’s inspiring message with the audience.

item.title: Navajo Code Talker and Iwo Jima Hero | Thomas Begay
item.description: An inspiring glimpse into the extraordinary bravery and legacy of Navajo Code Talker and Iwo Jima veteran Thomas Begay.

item.title: Unforgettable Smell on Utah Beach - D-Day Memories
item.description: A powerful recollection of Utah Beach where a single smell brings D-Day memories vividly back to life.

item.title: Were You Scared on D-Day?
item.description: A veteran reflects on the fear and courage that defined the D-Day landings.
